decks.notes: This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on a recurring value engine with Yorion, Sky Nomad as the companion. The deck includes a mix of removal options like Glass Casket, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Binding the Old Gods to control the board. Esika's Chariot and Emeria's Call provide additional threats and card advantage. Trail of Crumbs generates card advantage while Tangled Florahedron ramps mana. The deck relies on efficient creatures like Giant Killer, Gilded Goose, Wicked Wolf, Charming Prince, Drannith Magistrate, Skyclave Apparition, Elite Spellbinder, and the versatile Yorion. The mana base is well-balanced with various dual lands and Fabled Passage for consistency.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly build up a board presence and cycle through the deck to find key cards like Zenith Flare for massive burst damage. Drannith Stinger and Irencrag Pyromancer provide extra damage output, while Valiant Rescuer generates tokens. Improbable Alliance and Startling Development help create more tokens, while Memory Leak disrupts opponents' hands. The deck also includes some utility spells like Go for Blood and Boon of the Wish-Giver. The mana base is built around pathways for flexibility in mana fixing.

The deck focuses on using cheap cycling creatures and spells to quickly amass a board presence and cycle through the deck efficiently to find key cards like Zenith Flare for a big finish. Using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent value and recursion of key cards. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent early and closing out the game with a large Zenith Flare finish.

This deck focuses on using mill and disruptive control elements with cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Drown in the Loch, and Into the Story to slowly chip away at the opponent's deck while maintaining control of the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for further recursion of key creatures and spells. By establishing early board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to win through attrition and outlasting the opponent in the long game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By playing efficient creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant, along with cards like Embercleave and Kazuul's Fury, the deck aims to deal a significant amount of damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Garruk, Unleashed and Esika's Chariot provides additional value and allows for potential explosive turns. With a strong mana base and a focus on combat damage, this deck aims to win the game swiftly through aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and playing powerful threats such as Goldspan Dragon and Galazeth Prismari. This deck focuses on using cards like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with Mazemind Tome and Expressive Iteration. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Frost Bite and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through a combination of control and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on maintaining a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures with varying abilities and synergies to pressure the opponent quickly. By including Jegantha as a companion, the deck gains access to a powerful mana source that enables efficiency in casting its spells. The key strategy involves establishing an early board presence with efficient creatures like Jaspera Sentinel and Lovestruck Beast, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Elite Spellbinder and Drannith Magistrate. Showdown of the Skalds provides additional card advantage and tempo to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Drannith Magistrate and Elite Spellbinder. Lovestruck Beast and Jaspera Sentinel provide early threats, while Bonecrusher Giant and Giant Killer handle any threats from the opponent. The inclusion of companions like Jegantha, the Wellspring adds additional value to the deck. Showdown of the Skalds helps refuel the hand and maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to use fast and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures, such as Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, along with powerful cards like Showdown of the Skalds to gain card advantage and maintain momentum. It also includes disruptive creatures like Drannith Magistrate to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility and resources. Overall, the goal is to establish an aggressive board presence and maintain control until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with powerful abilities to quickly build a board presence and pressure the opponent. By incorporating cards like Drannith Magistrate and Elite Spellbinder to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and Showdown of the Skalds, the deck aims to maintain a consistent aggressive strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and value. By efficiently using its mana base and powerful creatures, this Naya Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure quick victories.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan. By leveraging powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Lovestruck Beast, along with disruptive cards like Elite Spellbinder and Giant Killer, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and mana ramp with Edgewall Innkeeper and Showdown of the Skalds to ensure a steady stream of threats and resources. With a solid mana base and versatile removal options, this deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to utilize control elements to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also generating card advantage and value through synergistic card interactions. The deck focuses on playing a long and grindy game, using cards like Mystical Dispute, Jwari Disruption, and Disdainful Stroke to counter and disrupt the opponent's spells. It also includes removal options like Heartless Act and Eliminate, as well as board wipes such as Shadows' Verdict and Extinction Event. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Omen of the Sea and Emergent Ultimatum for card selection and powerful late-game plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control spells, removal, and powerful creatures to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By ramping up with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven, the deck aims to cast big threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth to take control of the board. With a variety of counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke, along with versatile removal like Heartless Act and Shadows' Verdict, the deck aims to neutralize the opponent's threats while establishing its own win conditions. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the deck's flicker effects and card advantage.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control and card advantage through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. The deck aims to stall the game with removal and disruption spells while ramping up to powerful late-game plays such as Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility by flickering key permanents. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of efficient removal, counterspells, and game-winning threats.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Edgewall Innkeeper to provide additional versatility and card advantage. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is a key card that allows for explosive plays by cheating out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also includes counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke to control the opponent's plays, while also including removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with threats.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively use powerful creature cards like Edgewall Innkeeper, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast to control the board and pressure the opponent. Supporting cards like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and The Akroan War help to generate card advantage and provide additional threats. The deck also includes spells like Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke to counter opponent's key spells and disrupt their game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency with a mix of pathways and triomes.
